docs.lead_paragraph: Estrellita Bograd, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Miguel Bograd of Caracas, Venezuela, and New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Daniel Brodsky of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan Brodsky of New York and Marristown, N.J. Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel performed the ceremony in his study at Temple Emanu-El.

docs.abstract: Cuban press breaks traditional silence on OAS to quote dispatch from Costa Rica on meeting aimed at lifting econ sanctions (S)

headline.main: CUBA SANCTIONS, IMPOSED IN 1964, LIFTED BY O.A.S.; Vote at Costa Rica Meeting Effectively Ends Embargo  U.S. Joins Action O.A.S. Terminates Its Sanctions on Cuba

byline.original: By DAVID BINDER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, July 29 The Organization of American States tonight ended political and economic sanctions against Cuba, effectively abolishing the embargo imposed 11 years ago as a penalty for fostering Communist guerrilla activities in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, July 29 The Organization of American States tonight ended political and economic sanctions against Cuba, effectively abolishing the embargo imposed 11 years ago as a penalty for fostering Communist guerrilla activities in the hemisphere.
docs.abstract: OAS, in decision by 16 of 21 voting OAS members including US, on July 28 ends pol and econ sanctions against Cuba, effectively abolishing embargo imposed in '64 as penalty for fostering Communist guerrilla activities in hemisphere; Paraguay, Chile and Uruguay opposed resolution, Brazil and Nicaragua abstained; lifting of embargo will reptdly reintroduce certain amount of uniformity within OAS; despite lifting of embargo, Cuba will reptdly remain suspended from rights and obligations of Rio security treaty following action by 21 hemispheric foreign mins at Punte del Este, Uruguay, Jan '62, in which they accused Cuba of becoming part of 'Sino-soviet bloc;' US delegate William S Mailliard says US vote places issue in proper perspective and permits US to concentrate multilateral efforts on more fundamental problems of hemisphere; US has trade embargo with Cuba predating '64 OAS sanctions, involving expropriation by Cuba of Amer-owned property, American blocking of Cuban assets, and continued detention of pol prisoners, including some Amers; lifting of sanctions is reptdly not likely to alter Cuba's trading patterns appreciably since bulk of its exports go to Soviet-bloc countries; Costa Rican Pres Daniel Oduber Quiros, Foreign Min Gonzalo Facio, and Guatemalan delegate Miguel Solano Lopez, comment (M)

headline.main: CUBA SANCTIONS, IMPOSED IN 1964, LIFTED BY O.A.S.; Vote at Costa Rica Meeting Effectively Ends Embargo  U.S. Joins Action O.A.S. Terminates Its Sanctions on Cuba
